oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-06-15 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 15, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer), guest performer Autry Inman, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, the Jordanaires, Millie Kirkham, Chubby Wise, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 923rd broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hank Snow; Rod Brasfield; Autry Inman; Millie Kirkham; Chubby Wise; Jordanaires
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hank Snow -- The Golden Rocket (Hank Snow) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Autry Inman -- Footsteps Of The Bride (Autry Inman, Jordanaires, Millie Kirkham) -- Prince Albert commercial (Autry Inman, Hank Snow) -- Hank Snow introduces Chubby Wise -- Turkey In The Straw (Chubby Wise fiddle) -- Hank Snow talks -- These Things Shall Pass (Hank Snow, Jordanaires, Millie Kirkham)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Brasfield, Rod; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Kirkham, Millie; Wise, Chubby; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Snow, Hank; Inman, Autry
